Star Trek novel overrides

Source: R/helpers.R
pat_startrek.Rd

Pattern helper function specific to Star Trek novels. A function that takes no arguments and returns a named list of three elements: pattern is a regular expression pattern string, chapter_check is a character vector giving exact (in-metadata) book titles as a filter to only apply the supplemental pattern to specific books, and chapter_doublecheck is a vector of titles that applies additional checks that may only be necessary and helpful (and non-harmful) for specific titles.

pat_startrek()

Value

a named list.

Examples

pat_startrek()
#> $pattern
#> [1] "toc_ref\\d|^con$|^i2000\\d|^ref(\\d$|\\d\\d$)|^dreams-\\d"
#> 
#> $chapter_check
#>  [1] "INVINCIBLE"                                         
#>  [2] "Have Tech, Will Travel"                             
#>  [3] "SPARTACUS"                                          
#>  [4] "WAR DRUMS"                                          
#>  [5] "THE ROMULAN STRATAGEM"                              
#>  [6] "ROGUE SAUCER"                                       
#>  [7] "I,Q"                                                
#>  [8] "GEMWORLD: BOOK ONE OF TWO"                          
#>  [9] "The Genesis Wave Book Three"                        
#> [10] "Star Trek: The Next Generation: The Stuff of Dreams"
#> [11] "Memory Prime"                                       
#> 
#> $chapter_doublecheck
#>  [1] "MARTYR"                                             
#>  [2] "No Limits"                                          
#>  [3] "Spectre"                                            
#>  [4] "SPARTACUS"                                          
#>  [5] "WAR DRUMS"                                          
#>  [6] "THE ROMULAN STRATAGEM"                              
#>  [7] "ROGUE SAUCER"                                       
#>  [8] "I,Q"                                                
#>  [9] "GEMWORLD: BOOK ONE OF TWO"                          
#> [10] "Star Trek: The Next Generation: The Stuff of Dreams"
#> [11] "Memory Prime"                                       
#>
